main event: An unidentified aerial object was sighted near Manassas, Virginia on April 18, 1964 at around 7:30 PM local time.
interesting points: The object appeared to be three stars together forming a triangle, with erratic motion.
The object appeared to be breaking up, with a red spark that burned out, and looked as bright as a meteor at first.
The object was observed rising on the horizon and disappearing at an elevation of 45 degrees.
The wind direction and altitude were inconsistent with a balloon-type observation, but the sighting may have been associated with activities from the nearby Wallops Island launch facility.
The U.S. Air Force concluded that the sighting was likely a radiosonde balloon release from Washington, D.C. earlier that evening.
result: most likely a radiosonde balloon release
sighted object: three unidentified objects in the sky
